result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture of Controlled Substance-THC (>200-1000 Grams), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)2.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Huber privileges for work, school, treatment and childcare.
Defendant to notify probation agency by October 28, 2022 at 5:00 p.m.

miscConds.notes:
No new law violations.
No contact with firearms.
No alcohol and drugs unless prescribed.
AODA assessment.  Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens.
Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.

Provide DNA sample. Defendant to have DNA sample completed by October 28, 2022.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessments including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation. Bail on deposit to be applied first during the period of probation.  Bail on deposit to be applied. Any remaining to be returned to the provider.  If revoked to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in  a civil judgment.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel J Wojciechowski

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court.  Attorney Mark P. Powers Aty in court for Daniel J Wojciechowski.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for sentencing hearing. Sentencing proceeded. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Court sentenced the defendant to serve 12 MONTHS in the House of Correction, with credit for 3 days time served; Huber release for work, school, treatment, and childcare. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 24 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION; defendant to notify probation agency by October 28, 2022 at 5:00 pm.
-No new law violations. 
-Cooperate with agent. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; no alcohol and drugs, unless prescribed; random urine screens.
-Obtain/maintain full time employment/schooling or combination of both.
-50 hours community service with non-profit organization.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample; defendant to have DNA sample completed by October 28, 2022.
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at $0.00.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during the period of probation.  Bail on deposit to be applied first; any remaining balance to be returned to the provider.  If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Defendant is not eligible for expungement.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Filed: Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief.
Treatment Letter from Marvin Rankins.  Received and Filed.  nk

Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court.  Attorney Alexander R. Huppertz in court for Daniel J Wojciechowski on behalf of Attorney Mark Powers.  Attorney Abby Rockendorf in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for sentencing.  Attorney Powers in trial the previous week, and Attorney Huppertz requests a brief adjournment on behalf of Attorney Powers.  Court rescheduled the matter as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 16, Rm 503 CH.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 21, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Parties have reached a resolution. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement. 

Defendant changes plea to GUILTY as to COUNT 1.  

Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty.  Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen deportation is possible. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived their rights.  Plea questionnaire, addendum and jury instructions received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

Defendant is advised is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  
Defendant is advised unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  

Matter adjourned for sentencing hearing in Branch 16.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for October 10, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum to Plea and Elements/Jury Instruction received and filed.  bm

Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court with attorney Alex Huppertz on behalf of Mark P. Powers.  Patrick T. Franken appeared on behalf of Alexander Dyer for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Status Conference. All parties appeared via zoom. Discussions put forth on the record. Defense counsel requests Plea/ Sentencing hearing date. No objections from the State. Court grants request. Case adjourned to Br 16.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 11, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

OFF THE RECORD:
 Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Anthony Moore appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Matter set for Scheduling Conference.  Court granted defense request for time to receive discovery and offer. State shall deliver all known discovery to defense. Court grants defense's request for adjournment. This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.  This hearing will be streamed live on https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/a8cc2343-9b62-c309-778f-fa846faecb6a  Status conference scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Matthew Zisi appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daniel J Wojciechowski appeared by video means with Attorney.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 016941,
Payable Number: 986540,
Receipt Number: 22RP006830,
Amount: $20.00

Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription, no drug paraphernalia or no dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court ordered the remaining cash bail to be returned to the remitter.

Defendant Daniel J Wojciechowski in court with attorney Mark P. Powers.  Jessica Bellows appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16.
Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 25, 2022 at 08:30 am.
